sections.text:
This feature adds a bulk export API for the Messaging Library, enabling clients to retrieve all *approved* assets for a given workspace in a predictable, paginated way. By standardizing an export endpoint with cursor/limit pagination and stable ordering, downstream systems can reliably consume the library at scale without timing out or requiring full re-downloads on every sync.

The endpoint will support optional filters—asset type, segment/ICP, and `updated_since`—so consumers can target only the subset they need (e.g., “all approved one-liners for ICP X updated in the last week”). This reduces payload size and improves performance for both clients and our infrastructure, especially as the number of assets per workspace grows.

To support incremental syncing, responses will include sufficient metadata such as `next_cursor` (and `total_count` when feasible) so clients can page through deterministically and resume where they left off. Stable ordering is critical here to prevent duplicates or missed records across pages when assets are updated, and the design should make it straightforward for clients to implement “sync since last successful timestamp” workflows.

The primary impact is improved reliability and scalability of Messaging Library integrations: faster exports, fewer repeated full syncs, and a clearer contract for third-party and internal consumers. This ticket focuses on endpoint behavior and query performance; validation around approval-state and versioning correctness is explicitly handled separately in GOLD-44.
